title: Handover & Transition at Scale: Zero-Drama AMS Transfers
hook: Most AMS transitions fail quietly. Not on day one — three months later, when the same incidents return and nobody remembers why.
idea: A strong AMS handover is not a document delivery. It is a controlled transfer of system understanding, risk ownership, and decision logic — validated in real operations.
transition_scenarios: From project mode to steady-state AMS

business_layer: Critical business flows and their SLOs
What breaks revenue, cash, or compliance first
system_layer: SAP core boundaries (what must stay stable)
Custom code hotspots and no-go zones

prepare: Extract top 20 incident families with context
Map critical flows to owners and runbooks
Freeze non-essential change during transition window
shadow: Incoming team shadows real incidents and changes
cutover: Clear go/no-go criteria based on signals
stabilize: Close gaps found during live ops

handover_artifacts: Custom code ownership and risk list
validation_rules: No handover is complete without surviving real incidents.
If the new team cannot explain 'why', handover is incomplete.
Every critical flow must have a named, confident owner.

copilot_moves: Generate handover packs from historical incidents and boards.

anti_patterns_to_kill: Keeping old owners as silent safety nets
design_question: Could the new team handle a P1 incident alone tomorrow?
